version_description:
NEW IN 1.3.1:
+ Fixed a bug which caused iFont to crash when saving a message from the scratchpad
+ Fixed an issue with high-resolution assets for 5.5" iPhones

NEW IN 1.3:
+ Install fonts via cellular, WiFi is no longer required
+ New icon and branding to celebrate our relaunch
+ iPad support! More optimisations coming soon... (Please note: this feature is a work in progress and still in testing phase. Please report any problems or suggestions to help us improve your experience.)
+ Ability to email font profiles
+ Bug fixes

NEW IN 1.3.1:
+ Fixed a bug which caused iFont to crash when saving a message from the scratchpad
+ Fixed an issue with high-resolution assets for 5.5" iPhones

+ Install fonts via cellular, WiFi is no longer required
+ New icon and branding to celebrate our relaunch
+ iPad support! More optimisations coming soon... (Please note: this feature is a work in progress and still in testing phase. Please report any problems or suggestions to help us improve your experience.)
+ Ability to email font profiles
+ Bug fixes

+ Ability to email font profiles
+ Bug fixes

+ Install multiple font families in one profile with the handy new 'Bulk Install' option
+ Fixed an issue that prevented files containing spaces being imported successfully into iFont (sorry about that…)
+ Fixed an issue that prevented files from being exported from iFont (sorry about that one too…)

+ Install multiple font families in one profile with the handy new 'Bulk Install' option

iFont 4.1 lets you:
+ View TrueType collection files in the app (Please note: these cannot be installed)
+ Select multiple fonts to delete or install at a time

...and also includes minor bug fixes and improvements.

Thanks for using iFont! If it's been useful, please consider leaving us a review on the App Store.

+ Select multiple fonts to delete or install at a time

...and also includes minor bug fixes and improvements.

Thanks for using iFont! If it's been useful, please consider leaving us a review on the App Store.

With iFont 5.0, iFont is now a better place than ever to find, preview, and install fonts, with new features such as:
- An integrated web browser, so you can surf the web and add new fonts right within iFont
- Zoom View
- More accessible Wikipedia information for certain fonts
- Installing multiple fonts by email
- An extended help system throughout the app

This update makes life better for users with large font libraries, as imported font files can now be sorted and grouped to make finding files easier.

Group files by their family, installation status, and file type.
Sort files by their size, date added*, name

Also…
+ When installing multiple fonts at once a custom name can be specified for the installation profile
+ Search for fonts by their designer and manufacturer
+ Performance enhancements, including fixing a crash when importing multiple associated files with the same name

* this feature may be inaccurate on files imported from zip archives on previous versions of iFont

- View fonts installed by other apps using the new method (iOS 13 only)
- Fonts' support languages are now listed in full in English
- System fonts can now grouped by installation method, and ordered by number of fonts in family
- Better handling for .zip import errors

We have an exciting roadmap for iFont, and are hard at work on new features. We're also going to be focussing on reliability, in particular with regard to avoiding crashes.

Fixes a crash that could occur when rotating the device while running iFont.

We're aware of reports of iFont crashing at other times - if this has happened to you we'd be hugely grateful for any information about what you were doing when this happened, so we can fix the issue - just contact us at hello@codingcorner.co.uk

- Filter fonts by languages supported (iOS 13 only)
- Search terms now trigger filter suggestions for languages, which can be selected, appearing the search field as tokens.

- Information on supported character sets
- File size, date added information for all fonts
- Installed fonts can be sorted by date added and file size
- Installed fonts can be grouped by type
- More accurate font type information, based off their actual type not file extension
- Showcase view for glyphs

We've expanded the in-app purchase to cover customising the preview text and accessing the group and sort options, as a tentative first step to switching iFont from an ad-based to a freemium revenue model.

We've expanded the in-app purchase to cover customising the preview text and accessing the group and sort options, as a tentative first step to switching iFont from an ad-based to a freemium revenue model.

- Fonts can now be filtered by trait (for example bold, serif etc.)
- The number of filter suggestions can now be customised, within the range zero to ten
- Create collections of fonts (you can access these under the new 'Collections' tab)
- Improved font picker, with search functionality
- In Options, a (non-exhaustive) list of apps supporting custom fonts

Around the time you read this, iFont will break 1 million total downloads. We'd like to thank everyone who's used iFont along the way, and wish you all the best in these troubled times.

- In Options, a (non-exhaustive) list of apps supporting custom fonts

- Wikipedia browser uses SFSafariViewController
- Browse view:
- filter suggestion cells no longer have checkboxes in select mode
- actions container view accurately placed when displaying adverts
- filter fonts by font tables used
- expand and collapse sections
- Resolves an issue where non-installed fonts appeared under Installed Fonts if they came from a family for which some fonts were installed

Bug fixes for Spotlight integration, and installing fonts with an ampersand in their name.

Black Lives Matter. 
Going forward, a share of iFont's profits will be donated to important social causes, starting with those connected with the Black Lives Matter movement.

Users who've updated to iOS 14 will notice that some apps appear to have lost access to custom fonts. This isn't a problem with iFont: how apps access custom fonts changed in iOS 14, and many have not been updated yet to deal with this change. We appreciate how inconvenient and frustrating this must be to our users, and hope the issues get resolved soon.

More Featured Fonts, and one less typo (thanks for spotting Mike!)

iFont is fully compatible with iOS 14 - but many apps you'd normally use with custom fonts are not yet. We suggest contacting other developers to encourage them to release updates. In the mean time, you may want to try apps such as Pages and GoodNotes which already support custom fonts on iOS 14.

New in 7.3.2: expand and collapse all sections at once.

Not fixed in 7.3.2: other developers failing to update their apps for iOS 14. 

If an app has lost access to your fonts after you upgraded to iOS 14, it's because the app's developers have failed to update their app for iOS 14. We've been contacting effected developers to draw their attention to this as it's not something we can fix with an update to iFont.

Installer: 
- when sorting by install status includes a 'Not Installable' section
- when grouping by family or grouping by none and sorting alphabetically, iFont now shows section index titles
- when selecting fonts to install in bulk, an install option is still available when some of the selected fonts cannot be installed

Improved workflow for profile installation, and smart groups.

Improved workflow for profile installation, and smart groups.

We've levelled up smart groups: you can now create conditions covering:
- language
- font tables
- glyph count
- postscript name
- family name
- style name
- units per em
- designer
- designer URL
- manufacturer
- license
- license URL
- sample text
- postscript CID
- file size
- unique name
- version name
- character support
You can also create nested predicates, and drag and drop to reorder conditions.

We've also introduced a number of UI refinements and bug fixes, such as an redesigned Zip Archive opener dialog

Bug fixes:
- Unresponsive 'Install' and 'Remove' buttons for individual Featured Fonts

New features:
- View all fonts in a group by tapping on the 'eye' icon
- Customise configuration profiles' descriptions
- Data usage warning before installed Featured Fonts only triggered when a wifi connection is unavailable
- If a valid url is on the clipboard, it is automatically inserted when adding a new font source
